title: No Táxi (PT-BR) (Enhanced)
lines: Por favor, pegue o caminho mais rápido.
grammarBrief: The phrases in this deck mostly utilize imperative forms and polite requests. For example, 'Pode me deixar na...?' uses the verb 'poder' in the present indicative, which is a common way to form polite requests by asking if something is possible or permissible. In 'Pode ligar o taxímetro?', the verb 'ligar' is in its infinitive form following 'pode', maintaining the polite request format. Sentence structures in these examples tend to follow a pattern of [verb] + [object or complement], such as 'Pode ligar o taxímetro?' (Can you turn on the meter?) and 'Por favor, pegue o caminho mais rápido.' (Please take the fastest route.) These phrases often include polite additions like 'por favor' or 'obrigado' to enhance courtesy.

vocabulary.definition: a device in a taxi that calculates the fare based on distance traveled and time spent.
route or path, the way to get somewhere.
change; the money returned to someone who's paid at excess beyond the asked price.
